creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: wide river with bridge in background; 4 boats tethered at LL of image, a human figure working in the furthest boat from shore; tree and grass lined banks at L with a few buildings in background
inscription: left: 自刻　昭和拾七年作　淀川 {Jikoku, Shōwa jūshichinen saku, Yodogawa} | bottom, in grey: Yodo River | in pencil: Toshi Yoshida
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Yodo River
